card_answer:
###Art is something creative that expresses ideas and feelings.

---

_My sister likes to look at the art in the museum._

###A book is a set of printed sheets of paper that are held together inside a cover.

---

_The man smiles as he reads his favorite book._

###Clothes are what people wear to cover their bodies.

---

_I bought warm clothes for the cold winter._

###A community is a group of people who share the same area or interests.

---

_The community got together to plant trees._

###December is the twelfth month of the year.

---

_The last day of the year is December 31st._

###Dinner is the main meal eaten in the evening.

---

_I had a hamburger for dinner._

###To end is to stop or finish.

---

_They are happy because the teacher wanted to end the class early._

###To exchange is to give one thing in return for another.

---

_The men exchange business cards._

###A family is a group of people who are related to each other.

---

_There are four people in my family._

###From shows a starting place or position.

---

_Chris studies from 10 o’clock to noon every morning._

###Green is the color of growing grass or leaves.

---

_I don’t like green apples._

###A person’s home is the place where that person lives.

---

_The family likes to stay at home on the weekends._

###January is the first month of the year.

---

_My birthday is in January._

###Red is the color of blood.

---

_Jack is wearing a red shirt._

###Seven is the word for the number 7.

---

_I have seven colored pencils on my desk._

###To start is to begin doing something.

---

_Catherine has to start work at 8 o’clock in the morning._

###Together shows an action is done with another person or thing.

---

_Let’s work together to finish the project._

###A university is a school where people study for a degree.

---

_My dream is to go to a good university._

###To wear is to have clothing on your body.

---

_The man has to wear a suit to work._

###A year is a period of 365 days or twelve months.

---

_You become one year older every birthday._

###To appreciate something is to understand its good qualities.

---

_I can appreciate the lovely scenery._

###If something is available, it means you can get it.

---

_There were many seats available in the room._

###To beat someone means to do better than they do.

---

_I managed to beat everyone in the race._

###If something is bright, it gives off a lot of light.

---

_The bright light from the explosion hurt my eyes._

###To celebrate is to do something to show that an event is special.

---

_We all celebrated when we heard the great news._

###To decide is to make a definite choice.

---

_He tried to decide which one to eat first._

###To disappear means to go away or not be seen.

---

_The top of the building is disappearing in the clouds._

###If you talk about something else, you talk about something different.

---

_I wanted a bike for my birthday, but I got something else._

###Fair means reasonable or right.

---

_He sold me his car for a fair price._

###To flow is to move easily and continuously in one direction.

---

_The water flowed over the rocks and into the lake._

###If you move forward, you move in the direction in front of you.

---

_When he saw his mother, the baby crawled forward to her._

###A hill is a raised area of land. It is higher than the land around it.

---

_The sun was rising above the green hills._

###A level is a point on a scale that measures something.

---

_Please check the level of the temperature._

###A lone person or thing is the only one in a given place.

---

_A lone man walked along the street._

###A puddle is a pool of liquid on the ground.

---

_When the ice melted, it formed a puddle._

###A response is the answer to a question.

---

_He asked if I was sad. My response was “No.”_

###A season is a time of the year: spring, summer, fall, or winter.

---

_Fall is a warm season, while winter is very cold._

###A solution is a way to solve a problem.

---

_There are many problems. We need solutions!_

###To waste means to use something carelessly and unnecessarily.

---

_Turn off the water so you don’t waste it._

###You use whether when you must choose between two things.

---

_I could not decide whether to go left or right._

###Always means that something happens all the time.

---

_They always brush their teeth in the morning._

###To ask is to say or write something to get an answer.

---

_Please ask questions if you do not understand._

###A banana is a long yellow fruit with soft white flesh inside.

---

_Did you eat a banana for breakfast?_

###Bread is a food made from flour and water.

---

_You need two pieces of bread to make a sandwich._

###Cake is a sweet dessert made from flour, water, sugar, and eggs.

---

_What a beautiful birthday cake!_

###A carrot is an orange vegetable.

---

_I put a carrot in my salad._

###Chicken is a bird that is often used for food.

---

_Chicken is his favorite kind of meat._

###Chocolate is a sweet food made from cacao beans.

---

_I made a chocolate cake for my mom’s party._

###To contain is to hold or have something.

---

_I have to find something to contain these apples._

###If a food is delicious, it is tasty.

---

_I loved the delicious fried chicken I ate for dinner!_

###A diet is the food regularly eaten by a person.

---

_His diet mostly consists of fruits and vegetables._

###To eat is to chew and swallow food.

---

_You should eat breakfast every day._

###Food is things people and animals eat.

---

_Pasta is a famous food in Italy._

###Fruit is a type of healthy food that grows on trees and plants.

---

_Apples, pears, and oranges are types of fruit._

###When something is great, it is very good.

---

_It was a great, exciting game!_

###Health is the state of a person’s body.

---

_People who want good health should not smoke._

###A recipe is a set of instructions for cooking a certain type of food.

---

_Do you use a recipe when you make that sauce?_

###A restaurant is a business where people sit and eat food.

---

_Let’s eat at the Indian restaurant._

###If something is special, it is unique and different.

---

_The cupcake was special because it had blue frosting._

###Water is a clear liquid that people need to survive.

---

_Drink eight cups of water every day._

###Someone or something that is alive is not dead.

---

_My grandparents are still alive even though they are over 90._

###A bone is a hard part of the body.

---

_I brought home a nice bone for my dog._

###To bother is to make the effort to do something.

---

_No one bothered to wash the dishes today._

###A captain is the person who controls a ship or airplane.

---

_The captain sailed his ship to Australia._

###The conclusion of something is the final part of it.

---

_At the conclusion of the race, the spectators cheered for the winner._

###Doubt is a feeling of not being sure.

---

_I have doubt that the story is true._

###To explore is to look for new places.

---

_He wants to explore the world and see new things._

###If you are glad, you are happy.

---

_I am glad you came to my party._

###However means despite or not being influenced by something.

---

_She is a great cook. However, she never had professional lessons._

###Injustice is a lack of fairness or justice.

---

_Putting an innocent person in jail is an act of injustice._

###If something is international, it involves more than one country.

---

_The United Nations is a powerful international organization._

###A lawyer works with the law and represents people in court.

---

_The lawyer left the courthouse after the judge made her decision._

###To mention something is to talk about it.

---

_The doctors mentioned the problems that the patient was having._

###Someone who is old has lived for many years.

---

_My mother is seventy years old now._

###A policy is a rule.

---

_He told us that his policy was to put customers first._

###If something is social, it is about many people in a community.

---

_People should come together and fix the world’s social problems._

###A speech is something said to a group of people.

---

_She gave a speech to the class._

###A staff is a group of people working together in a company.

---

_My dad has a staff of four people to help him at the office._

###If you go toward something, you go closer to it.

---

_Santa walked toward my house with a bag of gifts._

###Wood is the thing that trees are made of.

---

_I put the pieces of wood in a pile._

###To achieve something is to successfully do it after trying hard.

---

_I was happy that I could achieve my goal._

###To advise someone is to tell them what to do.

---

_My mother often advises people about their money._

###If something happens already, it happens before a certain time.

---

_It is already time for the movie to start. Let’s go in._

###If something is basic, it is very simple or easy.

---

_I learned some basic English skills in school today._

###A bit is a small amount of something.

---

_I ate a bit of chocolate before I went to bed._

###To consider something means to think about it.

---

_Pete didn’t like his job. He considered getting a new one._

###To destroy means to damage something so badly that it cannot be used.

---

_The glass was destroyed._

###To entertain someone is to do something that they enjoy.

---

_The clown entertained the kids at the party._

###If something is extra, it is more than what is needed.

---

_The squirrel had extra nuts for the winter._

###A goal is something you work toward.

---

_Her goal was to become a doctor._

###To lie is to say or write something untrue to deceive someone.

---

_Whenever Pinocchio lied to his father, his nose grew._

###Meat is food made of animals.

---

_This piece of meat I’m eating tastes very good._

###An opinion is a thought about a person or a thing.

---

_Meg told me her opinion of my story. She said it was not funny._

###If something is real, it actually exists.

---

_Some people don’t believe in aliens from space, but I think they’re real._

###To reflect is when a surface sends back light, heat, sound or an image.

---

_Her face was reflected in the smooth glass._

###To regard people is to think of them in a certain way.

---

_The boy regarded the girl as a good friend._

###To serve someone is to give them food or drinks.

---

_He served us our drinks quickly._

###A vegetable is a plant used as food.

---

_Carrots are my favorite vegetable._

###A war is a big fight between two groups of people.

---

_Many young men died in the war._

###If something is worth an amount of money, it costs that amount.

---

_Our house is worth a lot of money._
